Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 541611: Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: The settlement amount includes $4,257,949 in legal fees and costs.
Private Litigation Case Title: Hnot, et al v. Willis Group, et al

Description: The settlement amount includes $3,200,896 in legal fees and costs. This case, which covers women working at the company beginning in 1998, is similar to the separately listed Hnot case, which covered the earlier period.
Private Litigation Case Title: Cronas v. Willis Group Holdings, Ltd. et al

Info Source: Insurance Broker to Reimburse Policy Holders $2.6 Million, US States News, July 17, 2007 (via Nexis).

Description: Insurance broker Willis agreed to pay $50 million to settle allegations that it unlawfully deceived clients by steering business to favored insurance companies, and soliciting fictitious bids to assure that insurance policies were placed to benefit insurers.

Info Source: U.S. REACHES $689,828 SETTLEMENT WITH CONSULTING COMPANY TO RESOLVE BILLING IRREGULARITIES COMPANY VOLUNTARILY DISCLOSED TO DOD, US Fed News, August 31, 2005 (via Nexis).

Private Litigation Case Title: Paulsen et al v. CNF, Inc et al
